chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per Attorney Bartelt, defendant did not have a ride. Plea and sentencing date requested. State does not object. Court sets plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. New charges filed. Continue status with other case.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant knowingly and freely waiver his right to a preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD but SPD does not have one appointed yet. Defendant is currently in jail on a probation hold. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.

DEFENDANT SHALL CONTACT PUBLIC DEFENDER'S OFFICE TODAY.
DEFENDANT SHALL NOT POSSESS OR CONSUME INTOXICANTS.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant to call SPD re this case. Attorney Bartelt represented defendant on another case. State requests $500 cash bond with condition: not to possess or consume intoxicants. Defendant heard. He was to start a new job at Sherwin Williams today. Court sets bond at $1000 signature with conditions: Call SPD today, not to possess or consume intoxicants. Status as to counsel set. Defendant may appear by phone if proof of employment provided from Sherwin Williams.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
